thread.title: Domino's Pizza worker spotted buying stock in ASDA
thread.title_full: Domino's Pizza worker spotted buying stock in ASDA

title: Domino's Pizza worker spotted buying stock in ASDA
text:
Domino's Pizza worker spotted buying stock in ASDA One man and his wedges Credit: SineadSarahxo 7 February 2017 â€¢ 3:29pm 
F ast food fans have criticised pizza chain Domino's after a staff member - wearing his Domino's uniform - was spotted buying a large quantity of potato wedges in an ASDA supermarket. 
The worker was photographed putting around 15 1kg bags of the seasoned wedges, priced at Â£1 a bag, through the till. 
The photo was uploaded to Twitter by SineadSarahxo , and to Facebook by Suzanne Fraser , on Sunday afternoon, going viral on both social networks. Thank you @dominos - next time I spend Â£3.99 on tiny portion of potato wedges I'll remember there from Asda!!! pic.twitter.com/31vJVrHfpy â€” SineadSarah (@SineadSarahxo) February 5, 2017 
M s Fraser wrote: "Next time you spend a fortune on wedges from Domino's, just remember there (sic) only a quid (at) Asda." 
Domino's charges Â£3.99 for a portion of wedges plus dip - representing a hefty mark-up if the pizza chain is buying them for Â£1 a kilogram. 
The photo has been shared close to 45,000 times of Facebook at time of writing, attracting a number of comments - some amused, some angry. @SineadSarahxo @dominos C'mon Domino's at least get your employees to get changed out of their uniform before hitting Asda for more supplies â€” LðŸŒ€Â©KÂ¥ ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ðŸŽ® (@Locky75New) February 6, 2017 @SineadSarahxo @dominos that works out at about 24p per chip for this measly portion I got the other week! pic.twitter.com/p1DW7PkyFL â€” Spex & Lipstick (@amiisteward) February 5, 2017 @MissKCSunshine @SineadSarahxo @dominos we won't be ordering them sides for Â£3.99 again like
